title: Hubert Herald
desc: Detailed knowledge of both historical and modern arms and emblems. Although most articles are in English, a few are in Dutch.

title: WappenWiki
desc: Lists historical shields of European states. Can be a bit historically questionable at times; but due to its distinct illustration style, it's still a great source of assets.

title: A Guide to Software for Heraldry
desc: My guide to software for heraldry - spanning vector, raster, and specially designed programs.

title: *A Glossary of Terms Used in Heraldry*
desc: One of the main heraldic dictionaries of note; has examples for many terms used, and a "synoptical table" of categories.

title: Elvin's Heraldic Dictionary
desc: Another old heraldic dictionary, containing some interesting illustrations and antiquated terms.

title: Heraldica
desc: A very dated-looking but still comprehensive site on heraldry covering a number of topics. Of particular interest is the [Heraldry by Country](https://www.heraldica.org/topics/national/index.html) section.

title: *The Handbook to English Heraldry*
desc: A classic, but sometimes inaccurate, book by one [Charles Boutell](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Boutell), primarily focusing on English heraldry.

title: *A Complete Guide to Heraldry*
desc: The definitive guide to heraldry in England, by [A. C. Fox-Davies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arthur_Charles_Fox-Davies). Although it is for the most part accurate, a few of his opinions (like that on the heraldic white) are best ignored. [The Art of Heraldry](https://archive.org/details/artofheraldryenc00foxd), is a related volume that draws upon some of the same material.

title: Links to Online Rolls of Arms
desc: A list of rolls of arms available online, hosted by the Viking Answer Lady.

title: Vakhushti Georgian flags collage
desc: An image containing semi-heraldic flags collected by Georgian cartographer [Prince Vakhushti](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vakhushti_of_Kartli).

title: Heraldic Sources
desc: A massive compendium of heraldic books organised by country, intended as the basis for an armorial project that has, as of this writing, not been started.

title: Book of all Kingdoms
desc: An interesting medieval book which contains numerous semi-heraldic banners which... are not very accurate, to say the least.

title: Flags of the World
desc: Although its main remit is flags, as the name implies, and the web design looks rather vintage, it actually contains a bunch of heraldic knowledge. Don't trust the blazons, though.

title: International Heraldry
desc: Explains the basics of international heraldry; very handy for newcomers to the field.

title: European Heraldry
desc: Displays arms of historical European states, similar to WappenWiki. Unlike WappenWiki though, the artstyle is atrocious.

title: Heraldicum.ru
desc: A Russian heraldic website. Although there is an English version available, you might be better of using Google Translate, as it's not very big.

title: Postcards with coats of arms
desc: A Polish online museum page containing a selection of historical heraldic artifacts from that country.

title: Finto HERO
desc: Operated by the Finnish government, this is an experimental relational thesaurus for heraldic terms in a vast array of languages, complete with illustrations.

title: *An encyclopaedic dictionary of heraldry*
desc: A more recent heraldic dictionary by noted heraldist Julian Franklin.

title: *Fictitious and Symbolic Creatures in Art*
desc: Not exclusively heraldic, but still very relevant. Deals with mythological beasts of European origin.

title: Vocabulaire-Atlas Héraldique
desc: Gathers a large variety of heraldic terms and provides translations in five languages. An [online version](https://www.heraldica.org/topics/glossary/atlas.htm) is available at Heraldica.

title: Mistholme Pictorial Dictionary of Heraldry
desc: Accurately describes some obscure features, but at the cost of including some glaring mistakes and quirks of the SCA, who the book is intended for.

title: Category:en:Heraldry
desc: A listing of all heraldic terms mentioned by [Wiktionary](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/Wiktionary:Main_Page)

title: The Canadian Heraldic Dictionary
desc: In the heraldic world, Canada is famous for its unusual, controversial, and creative designs. This dictionary collects many of them.

title: Book of Traceable Heraldic Art
desc: A compendium of free-to-use heraldic images from a variety of sources. The Viking Answer Lady hosts a [similar page](http://www.vikinganswerlady.com/Stars/Heraldry_SVG_Images/index.htm), of her own images.

title: DrawShield
desc: An online application that allows you to create designs based on heraldic language. Although not all-encompassing, it allows a surprisingly wide range of possibilities, and the site also hosts a wide array of related resources, including a gallery, heraldic tutorial, and some heraldic dictionaries.

title: Portal:Heraldry/Web resources
desc: Wikipedia's list of external heraldic resources, including heraldic authorities in some countries.

title: Chivalric & Heraldic Terminology
desc: The misspelling of the URL (*chi**varl**ic*) isn't indicative of the quality of the content: it contains quite a few rare terms that are difficult to find elsewhere.

title: Official Blazons Wiki
desc: Official descriptions of national (and some regional) coats of arms and emblems.

title: Escutcheons of Science
desc: Arms of notable scientists, explorers, and industrialists, maintained by French engineer Dr. Gerard P. Michon.

title: Arkiv Jan Raneke
desc: A detailed Swedish classification of European noble coats of arms with charming hand-drawn art.

title: *Stemmatographia*
desc: An armorial combining fictional and historic arms that is influential in the Balkan region.

title: Heraldry of the World
desc: Not only a great reference for civic and regional arms, but also a veritable collection of historic artifacts.

title: Europeana Heraldica
desc: The Finnish state records of arms relating to that country's history.

title: Heraldry in the *Scher Collection*
desc: A collection of coins with heraldic designs.

title: Period Armorials Online
desc: A listing of over 150+ period heraldic rolls and miscellaneous records.

title: Simple Heraldry
desc: An excellent heraldic primer characterized by its cheerful illustrations.

title: Ströhl's Heraldischer Atlas
desc: The German counterpart to Fox-Davies' work, beautifully illustrated by its author.

title: Rietstap's Armorial General
desc: A monumental work containing the arms of thousands of European families.

title: Burke's General Armory
desc: An equivalent focused entirely on Great Britain and Ireland.

title: Garcia's Enciclopedia Heráldica y Genealógica Hispano-Americana
desc: A heraldic and genealogical encyclopedia for Spain and Latin America.

title: Costa's Tratado Completo de la Ciencia del Blason
desc: A Spanish glossary.

title: Owlturd Comic
desc: A comic for people who want to make art but don't know how to get started.

title: CHA Example Chart
desc: Example arms with their elements labelled.
